intro: Coumarouna nudipes, commonly known as the African sarsaparilla, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by orange-red, fleshy fruits. Its roots and leaves have been traditionally used in herbal medicine for their purported health benefits. The botanical features of Coumarouna nudipes make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
